title: Landscape Differences Along the 30 ° North Latitude

text.title: Sahara
text.text: The Sahara Desert is the largest tropical desert climate in the world, accounting for about 1/3 of the African continent. The climate is dry and rainless, with strong wind and sand, and strong evaporation. Only a few hardy vegetation grow, and the population density is the lowest in the world.

text.title: Iran Plateau
text.text: 30 ° N passes through the southern part of the Iranian plateau and passes through the alpine climate and subtropical steppe and desert climate areas. There is little precipitation and large temperature differences. The main source of water comes from the mountains, ice and snow, and the grasslands are widely spread.

text.title: Everest
text.text: 30 ° N just crosses the highest peak of the Himalayas, Mount Everest. At an altitude of 8,844.43 meters, the world's highest mountain front is magnificent, and the glacial landform is widespread.

text.title: Middle and Lower Yangtze River Plain
text.text: The plain in the middle and lower reaches of the Yangtze River is a typical impingement plain. The water network is light and densely populated. Under the influence of the subtropical monsoon climate, a" home of fish and rice "at 30 ° N is formed.
